de.systemagmbh.tools.config
Class CSysGenericConfigItem

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.tools.config.ASysConfigItem
      de.systemagmbh.tools.config.CSysGenericConfigItem
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, ISysConfigItem, Serializable
public final class CSysGenericConfigItem
extends ASysConfigItem
implements Serializable

This class implements an ISysConfigItem for generic configurations.

The value of the item is always stored in a String. The children are in no special order.

The items children are stored in a hashtable. Therefore every child must have an unique name or addItem will overwrite an existing child.

Version:
$Revision: 1.9 $
Author:
Eugen Obermeier, Udo Friedrich
See Also:
ISysConfigItem, Serialized Form

getItem

public ISysConfigItem getItem(String[] fullName)
                       throws CSysItemNotFoundException
Returns the first child with the same name. This is a convenience method if you already have the name and path of an item in a string array (e. g. as returned by getPath()).

Specified by:
getItem in interface ISysConfigItem
Parameters:
fullName - full path and name

CSysItemNotFoundException - if no child with this name exists.
See Also:
ISysConfigItem.getItem(java.lang.String[])

getItem

public ISysConfigItem getItem(String name)
                       throws CSysItemNotFoundException
Cannot handle path notation to get a sub-sub-child of this item with one getItem() operation. 
   getItem("thisSection/subSection/anItem")
searches for a child named thisSection/subSection/anItem and does not search for a child named anItem in the child item subSection of this items child thisSection.

Specified by:
getItem in interface ISysConfigItem
Parameters:
name - the name of the child item to search for
Returns:
the found item
Throws:
CSysItemNotFoundException - if no child with this name exists.

getItem

public ISysConfigItem getItem(String name,
                              int searchDepth)
                       throws CSysItemNotFoundException
Windows INI files have a flat structure. So searching backwards in root direction is not possible. This call only wraps the call to getItem(name).

Specified by:
getItem in interface ISysConfigItem
Parameters:
name - the name of the child item to search for
searchDepth - the number of levels in root direction
Returns:
the found item
Throws:
CSysItemNotFoundException - if not found.
See Also:
ISysConfigItem.getItem(String)

getOptionalItem

public ISysConfigItem getOptionalItem(String name)
Returns the first child with the same name or an empty child, if not found. Use this method to get a value from an item that is not mandatory. Example:
   ISysConfigItem anItem;
   Boolean b;
   b = root.getOptionalItem("This/Path/Does/Not/Exist/theBooleanItem")
       .getBooleanValue(new Boolean(true));
In the given example getItem() would throw a CSysItemNotFoundException.

Specified by:
getOptionalItem in interface ISysConfigItem
Parameters:
name - the name of the item to find or the name of the item to create, if not found
Returns:
the found item or a new item with the given name
See Also:
ISysConfigItem.getOptionalItem(java.lang.String)

createItem

public ISysConfigItem createItem(String name,
                                 Object value)
Creates a new item with the given name and the given value that has no parent. The type of the new item is determined by the specified value.
  • value != null type = parameter
  • value == null type = section

Specified by:
createItem in interface ISysConfigItem
Parameters:
name - name of the new item
value - value of the new item.
Returns:
created config item
See Also:
ISysConfigItem.createItem(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object)
